value:
I once thought this outfit too somber,
but I've come to think it suits me. I
can show a different side of myself...

On stage, I cover my face with a veil.
My mother was a songstress with no
equal, you see...$k$pI don't want that to color people's
opinions of me.

There's always a price to be paid for
power. You can summon Heroes, but
at what cost to yourself?$k$pI hope I don't have to worry about you.

Come, let's go for a walk together. It's
too bad my pegasus isn't here... We
could have strolled the skies.

Ah, it's you. I was just practicing my
singing. I wonder how far my voice
could reach...

You are the ocean's gray waves...
Ah, you've caught me in a song. I've
simply come to say hello...

Wonderful. I can only grow by
experiencing many things.
I have a little catch in my throat...

I am sorry. My feelings are muted
just now. Ah, well.

I'm glad. This can only mean that
you have high expectations of me.

I'm Shigure. My songs hold
mysterious power. Would you like me
to sing one for you?

You've come to hear me sing some
more? I like that you come alone. It
helps me concentrate.$k$pI prefer singing for just one person. I
know that you must be wondering why
I performed at that festival, then...$k$pI'm searching for someone—my
mother. She went missing after the
war ended.$k$pYou see, I thought that maybe, just
maybe...if I sang there, and if I used
the power I have...$k$pThen maybe I'd see her in the
audience. That's why I was there. I
sound like a fool, don't I?$k$pI may not have found my mother, but
I did find you. You need me, so I'll
sing for you while I can.
えいっ！
せやあっ！
ううっ！
Why?
My heart is singing...
Time for a requiem.
The end of melody...
Forgive me.
Remember me.
Ehee
Glad to sing for you.
Don't exhaust yourself.
My mother's singing brimmed with power. I thought that my singing...had no such effect.
I love festivals. But less so, crowds.
Please, there's no need to worry yourself over me.
I'd like to sing my heart out somewhere. In some ruins, perhaps.
I don't like singing for an audience. Unless, of course, that audience is you. You are often in my thoughts.
What now?
Shall I sing?
What a stage.
